A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
This is the movie that Star Wars fans feared when the franchise was sold to Disney. But then The Force Awakens and Rogue One were both really well made. Now they drop this Christmas turd on us.
 The movie begins with a "Yo Momma" joke and the writing never gets much better from there. 
This thing was an hour too long and felt more like a quick-turnaround Avengers movie than a Star Wars film. 
The Snoke\, Ren\, Rey fight scene was the only memorable part of this. But you never learn who Snoke was or what motivated him. That's just poor storytelling.
